alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 13 at 8:29PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 822 PM HST, radar and rain gages indicated spotty slow- moving heavy showers over both windward and leeward portions of the Big Island, with showers more widespread over leeward areas, including Waikoloa. A rain gage in Honaunau has received over 2 inches of rain this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Papaikou, Pepeekeo, Waiakea Uka, portions of Saddle Road, Kailua-Kona, Captain Cook, Waikoloa Village, Kealakekua, Honaunau, Holualoa, Keauhou and Puuanahulu. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 1015 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
